mods.note: Telegrams :— “T8AVAUX, WIRE, LONDON.’. Telephone Number :— RELIANCE 76 1 I E«D.l/H.a.S« Any reply to this letter should quote the above number, and must be addressed to :— 1 he SECRETARY, as opposite. Your reference Dear Staines, T.IINfSTRY oTxYO^KS, 53^ - LAMBETH BRIDGE HOUSE^ ALBERT EMBANKMENT, LONDON, S.E.l. T >» * IV 2 $ August, 1947* INDEXED Our Chief Scientific Adviser, Sir Reginald Stradling, is going on a Mission to Australia and New Zealand and is travelling by air# We have arranged contacts for him at most of his places of call, but we are anxious to have him met at Bahran, where he is expected to arrive by flying boat on the evening of Thursday of next week, September 4th. I understand that the Foreign Office has a political representative there, and we should be very grateful if he could be advised of Sir Reginald* s coming and have him looked after for the night. Will you be good enough to fix this up or put the bearer of this letter, Mr* Ashley, on to the right person. / I should like to be able to tell Sir Reginald the name of X / the representative who will meet him. Yours sincerely.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Ext 1865/47 'Sir Reginald Stradling: visit to Bahrain en route for Australia and New Zealand'

physicalDescription.extent: The file's contents are arranged in approximate chronological order from the front to the rear of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 4, these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file consists of a letter and draft telegram between the Secretary of the Ministry of Works and the Foreign Office, regarding the arrangement of a visit to Bahrain by Chief Scientific Adviser to the Ministry of Works, Reginald Stradling, while en route to Australia and New Zealand for a mission.
